* Less than zero -> x is less than y.
* Zero -> x equals y.
* Greater than zero x is greater than y.

member.name: T:Tethys.Forms.NumericTextBox
member.summary:
The numeric text box takes numeric(decimal) values as input. It has the following extra properties:
NumericPrecision: Precision
NumericScaleOnFocus: The scale to display when the text box has got the focus.
NumericScaleOnLostFocus: The scale to display when the text box hasn't got the focus.
NumericValue: The current numeric value displayed in the text box (decimal)
ZeroIsValid: Zero is a valid as input
AllowNegative: Allow input of negative decimal numbers
It has the following extra events:
NumericValueChanged: The event fires when the numeric value changes
by user input or programmatically.(Like TextChanged)
Use NumericValueChanged event instead of the TextChanged event! The NumericValue property is also capable of data binding. The decimal number is displayed with grouping char.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Points to the name of the section of the registry or the application's INI file where the MRU file list is read and/or written.
Points to a format string to be used for the names of the entries stored in the registry or the application's INI file.
Maximum number of files in the MRU file list.
Maximum length, in characters, available for the menu display of a filename in the MRU file list.
member.remarks: The format string pointed to by entryFormat should contain "{0}", which will be used for substituting the index of each MRU item. For example, if the format string is "file%d" then the entries will be named file0, file1, and so on.

member.name: M:Tethys.Forms.RecentFileList.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the file whose path is given in file to the most recently used (MRU) file list.
member.param: Pathname to be added to the list.
member.remarks: The file name will be added to the top of the MRU list. If the file name already exists in the MRU list, it will be moved to the top.

member.name: M:Tethys.Forms.RecentFileList.GetDisplayName(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Obtains a display name for a file in the MRU file list, for use in the menu display of the MRU list.
member.param: Full path of the file whose name is to be displayed in the menu list of MRU files.
member.returns: Full path of the file whose name is to be displayed in the menu list of MRU files or an abbreviated path.
member.remarks: If the file is in the current directory, the function leaves the directory off the display. If the filename is too long, the directory and extension are stripped. If the filename is still too long, the display name is set to an empty string unless bAtLeastName is nonzero.

member.name: M:Tethys.Forms.TableLayoutPanelSizable.IsDesignMode(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Diese Funktion dient der umgehung des .DesignMode Problems in .Net Die Eigenschaft .DesignMode eines Controls, welches die ISite Schnittstelle implementiert gibt zurck, ob sich das Control im DesignMode befindet. Sobald das Control in ein anderes Control im Designer eingebettet wird gibt die Eigenschaft immer false zurck, obwohl noch im Designer gearbeitet wird. Diese Funktionalitt steht noch nicht im Konstruktor zur verfgung, Diese Eigenschaft kann im Load Event eines Controls abgefragt werden.
member.param: Control, welches auf den DesignMode berprft werden soll.
member.returns: True Wenn sich das Control im DesignMode befindet.

member.name: T:Tethys.Forms.TimeoutMessageBox
member.summary: TimeoutMessageBox implements a message box that is closed automatically after a given timeout.
member.remarks:
How does it work? Just before calling MessageBox.Show(...), SetWindowsHookEx(WH_CALLWNDPROCRET,) is called. The hook procedure looks for a WM_INITDIALOG on a window with text equal to the message box caption. A windows timer is started on that window with the appropriate timeout. When the timeout fires EndDialog is called with the result set to the dialog default button ID. You can get that ID by sending a dialog box a DM_GETDEFID message. Pretty simple.
This implementation is based on the work of RodgerB that has been published on Code Project.

member.summary: This is the function called by the Windows hook management. We assume, that when an WM_INITDIALOG message is sent and the window text is the same like the one of our window that the window to hook call comes from is indeed our window. We start the timer and unhook ourselves.
